sub_title: Engineering Manager Central Upstream at Shell
summary:
Aloysius Johannes Nicolaas Vreenegoor was born on November 7, 1960 in Hillegom, The Netherlands. The following schools were attended and completed successfully:

• 1968-1974: Jozef School, Hillegom, The Netherlands (Elementary School).

• 1974-1980: Atheneum Hageveld, Heemstede, The Netherlands.
	
• 1980-1986: Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands. Obtained a Cum Laude degree on Applied Mathematics Faculty of the Delft University of Technology (thesis on conical flows around supersonic delta-wings).

• 1986-1990: PhD, Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands. Obtained the PhD degree on Applied Mathematics Faculty of the Delft University of Technology. PhD work completed with a thesis on the mathematical modeling of two-phase bubbly flows.

After his PhD A.J.N. Vreenegoor joined Shell in June 1990, starting his career in the Equipment Engineering (EE) Department at KSLA: the Royal Dutch Shell Laboratory in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, presently named Shell Technology Center Amsterdam (STCA). After a 1-year assignment (July 1995 – June 1996) at Shell Oil’s Westhollow Technology Center (WTC) in Houston (Texas, US), he returned at STCA as Team Leader Multiphase Flow of the OGUF Fluid Flow Business Group (BG), part of a Research and Technical Services organization that was soon to be transferred into a new technology company providing technical services to Shell and non-Shell companies on a fully commercial basis: Shell Global Solutions, where he  was appointed Business Team Manager (BTM) of the OGUA Flow Assurance BG. A second international assignment followed from 2003 to 2006, where he combined his BTM duties with technical work in the Flow Assurance Systems Team. In 2006 he relocated back to Amsterdam to become the Regional Manager of the GSUF Fluid Flow & Flow Assurance Delivery Group (DG). As of January 2010 A.J.N. Vreenegoor is the manager of the new Pipelines, Flow Assurance & Subsea Systems delivery group.

Specialties: Fluid Mechanics (visco-elastic flow, multiphase flow), Flow Assurance, Slug Mitigation, Liquid Management, Pipeline Production Systems, CFD Modeling (Fluent, Polyflow, CFX, OLGA), Lab Experimentation, Innovation and R&D, Technical Management, Technical Services, Trouble Shooting & Remediation

profile_positions.description: Engineering Manager of the Central Upstream Asset Support Team providing Cross-discipline support to Upstream Assets globally, including technology deployment and D&R support.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Manager Central Upstream

profile_positions.description: Engineering Manager of the Central Upstream Asset Support Team providing Cross-discipline support to Upstream Asset globally, including technology deployment and D&R support
profile_positions.title: Engineering Manager Central Upstream

profile_positions.description: Managing a group of 39 staff involved in tech service, project support and innovation in the areas of pipelines and flow assurance.
profile_positions.title: Manager Pipelines, Flow Assurance & Subsea Systems

profile_positions.description: Critical constributions to the successful consolidation of two delivery groups into one, adding 10 more staff to his staff responsibility. Clearly delivering on increasing the Technical Utilisation in Amsterdam and successfully implementing the “Winning in the Dowturn” strategy.
profile_positions.title: Regional Manager Fluid Flow & Flow Assurance

profile_positions.description: Reassumed the managerial position of the Flow Assurance group in Amsterdam, also covering the office in Kuala Lumpur. Perform senior high level technical work in the Work Process Solutions Team, focused on developing advanced Flow Assurance integrated software solutions.
profile_positions.title: Regional Manager Flow Assurance

profile_positions.description: Continue assisting the Houston based Business Group Manager with managing the globally operating GSUA BG (65 staff in HOU, AMS and KL). Assist with daily management tasks associated with the Houston based staff and business. Participate in formulating the global Business Plan and growing the business. Running technical flow assurance services to offshore industry as part of the GSUA Systems team. Received various recognitions including 4 SRA's for work on Mensa, Coulomb, Brazil BC-10 and Indepence Hub (Atwater Valey Group of Producers).
profile_positions.title: Business Team Manager Flow Assurance, Houston

profile_positions.description: Assisting the Houston based Business Group Manager with managing the globally operating OGUA Flow Assurance BG: a new Shell Global Solutions Business Group, started 1 January 2002. Managerial responsibility for the Amsterdam based people and business. Participate in formulating the global Business Plan and growing the business. Growing the Amsterdam side of OGUA from 6 to 10 people, accomplished in August 2002. Running technical flow assurance services to offshore industry as part of the OGUA Applications team.
profile_positions.title: Business Team Manager Flow Assurance, Amsterdam

profile_positions.description: Modeling of threephase flow through long pipelines in the offshore industry. Technology development in collaboration with two Norwegian oil companies: Statoil and Norsk Hydro. Development of the S3 Slug Suppression System to stabilize production of oil and gas on offshore platforms. Selling technical multiphase flow services on a commercial basis to Shell and non-Shell companies, as part of the new Shell Global Solutions company. Commercializing the S3 by means of a licensing agreement with Dril-Quip (Houston, Texas, US). Managing a team of six people with respect R&D projects, technical services, lab and offshore testing, team financial performance, team business plan, performance appraisals and customer contacts. Operating in a global mode with the Multiphase Flow team at WTC.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Multiphase Flow

profile_positions.description: CFD modeling of complex flows (multiphase, turbulent, non-Newtonian) through 3D geometries. R&D work in combination with technical support to refineries and chemical plants. Promoting and increasing contacts and collaboration between WTC and STCA.
profile_positions.title: Exchange Scientist WTC Houston

profile_positions.description: Modeling of visco-elastic flows associated with extrusion and injection molding of polymer melts. R&D work in combination with technical support to chemical plants. Managing a team of three people with respect R&D projects, technical services and performance appraisals.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Polymer Processing
